channel.title: CRASH on Silo level
channel.description: Hello, I am experiencing a game crash just after I start the large fan in Silo D (to kill the tentacle creature). Seems to crash just as the fan spins up to a faster speed. Here is the error report I get from windows: Problem Event Name: APPCRASH Application Name: hl2.exe Application Version: 0.0.0.0 Application Timestamp: 470c11ae Fault Module Name: client.dll Fault Module Version: 0.0.0.0 Fault Module Timestamp: 504ecc4f Exception Code: c0000005 Exception Offset: 00362edd OS Version: 6.1.7601.2.1.0.256.48 Locale ID: 3081 Additional Information 1: 0a9e Additional Information 2: 0a9e372d3b4ad19135b953a78882e789 Additional Information 3: 0a9e Additional Information 4: 0a9e372d3b4ad19135b953a78882e789 I've also attached the crashdump file. If any further information is required, please ask. hl2_4104_crash_2012_9_18T12_1_42C0.mdmp (109 KB)

item.title: CRASH on Silo level
item.dc:creator: Cleptomaniac
item.description:
Sagnar:

Destroy the pallet and the wooden box down there entirely. Seems like the game dosen’t like physics.

Worked for me.

yep, that’s it. had the same problem and i just threw all the wooden trash down the hole, now it works!

Read full topic

item.title: CRASH on Silo level
item.dc:creator: Trekcicity
item.description:
Hello,

I am experiencing a game crash just after I start the large fan in Silo D (to kill the tentacle creature). Seems to crash just as the fan spins up to a faster speed.

Here is the error report I get from windows:

Problem Event Name: APPCRASH
Application Name: hl2.exe
Application Version: 0.0.0.0
Application Timestamp: 470c11ae
Fault Module Name: client.dll
Fault Module Version: 0.0.0.0
Fault Module Timestamp: 504ecc4f
Exception Code: c0000005
Exception Offset: 00362edd
OS Version: 6.1.7601.2.1.0.256.48
Locale ID: 3081
Additional Information 1: 0a9e
Additional Information 2: 0a9e372d3b4ad19135b953a78882e789
Additional Information 3: 0a9e
Additional Information 4: 0a9e372d3b4ad19135b953a78882e789

I’ve also attached the crashdump file.

If any further information is required, please ask.
hl2_4104_crash_2012_9_18T12_1_42C0.mdmp (109 KB)

Read full topic
